front.title: Approximate matching

author.organization: National Institute of Standards and Technology (U.S.).

front.abstract: Approximate matching is a promising technology for designed to identify similarities between two digital artifacts. It is used to find objects that resemble each other or to find objects that are contained in another object. This can be very useful for filtering data for security monitoring, digital forensics, or other applications.

seriesInfo.name: NIST special publication; NIST special pub; NIST SP
